ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary: Provides ANOCVA (ANalysis Of Cluster VAriability), a non-parametric statistical test to compare clustering structures with applications in functional magnetic resonance imaging data (fMRI). The ANOCVA allows us to compare the clustering structure of multiple groups simultaneously and also to identify features that contribute to the differential clustering.

Provides ANOCVA (ANalysis Of Cluster VAriability), a non-parametric statistical test to compare clustering structures with applications in functional magnetic resonance imaging data (fMRI). The ANOCVA allows us to compare the clustering structure of multiple groups simultaneously and also to identify features that contribute to the differential clustering.

name: r-anocva
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = '0.1.1' %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-anocva
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/anocva_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/anocva/anocva_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 39374e5849fbd2ee428bc0d4b90168c3c884b04fb06819400a331c452520cfaf

build:
  number: 4
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
    - cross-r-base {{ r_base }}    # [build_platform != target_platform]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-cluster
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-cluster

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('anocva')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('anocva')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=anocva
  license: GPL-3.0-only
  summary: Provides ANOCVA (ANalysis Of Cluster VAriability), a non-parametric statistical test
    to compare clustering structures with applications in functional magnetic resonance
    imaging data (fMRI). The ANOCVA allows us to compare the clustering structure of
    multiple groups simultaneously and also to identify features that contribute to
    the differential clustering.
  license_family: GPL3
  license_file:
    - '{{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-3'

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r

# Package: anocva
# Type: Package
# Title: A Non-Parametric Statistical Test to Compare Clustering Structures
# Version: 0.1.1
# Author: Maciel C. Vidal [aut, cre], Andre Fujita [aut]
# Maintainer: Maciel C. Vidal <calebe@ime.usp.br>
# Description: Provides ANOCVA (ANalysis Of Cluster VAriability), a non-parametric statistical test to compare clustering structures with applications in functional magnetic resonance imaging data (fMRI). The ANOCVA allows us to compare the clustering structure of multiple groups simultaneously and also to identify features that contribute to the differential clustering.
# License: GPL (>= 3)
# LazyLoad: Yes
# Encoding: UTF-8
# Depends: R (>= 2.10.0)
# NeedsCompilation: no
# Imports: cluster
# Suggests: MASS, igraph
# Repository: CRAN
# RoxygenNote: 6.0.1
# Packaged: 2017-11-10 01:54:35 UTC; calebe
# Date/Publication: 2017-11-10 04:27:50 UTC
